findings.title: Constructor Mismatch
findings.description: The constructor of a contract does not match its intended behavior.

findings.title: Ownership Takeover
findings.description: The administration key concern can be alleviated by transferring the role to a community-governed DAO.

findings.title: Redundant Fallback Function
findings.description: The contract contains a redundant fallback function which can lead to potential issues.

findings.title: Overflows & Underflows
findings.description: Potential arithmetic overflows and underflows in SurfswapPair::swap() function due to unchecked multiplication operations.

findings.title: Reentrancy
findings.description: The _safeTransfer function can be vulnerable to reentrancy attacks due to its usage of external calls.

findings.title: Money-Giving Bug
findings.description: The addLiquidity function allows users to mint liquidity without providing the required amount of tokens, resulting in free tokens being given away.

findings.title: Unchecked External Call
findings.description: The SurfswapPair contract has an unchecked external call in the swap function.

findings.title: Gasless Send
findings.description: The function uses _safeTransfer to transfer tokens without considering gas costs, potentially leading to failed transactions.

findings.title: Send Instead Of Transfer
findings.description: Using _safeTransfer instead of transfer can lead to potential issues if the recipient is a contract.

findings.title: (Unsafe) Use Of Predictable Variables
findings.description: The use of predictable variables can introduce security vulnerabilities in smart contracts.

findings.title: Transaction Ordering Dependence
findings.description: This finding relates to weaknesses in data processing issues, potentially causing unintended behavior due to incorrect transaction ordering.
